alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Floyd; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Paulding, southeastern Floyd, eastern Polk and southwestern Bartow Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Taylorsville, or 12 miles west of Cartersville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cartersville, Rockmart, Euharlee, Aragon, Kingston, Taylorsville, Seney, Fish Creek, Stilesboro, Antioch and Van Wert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
